stint.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a period of time spent doing a particular job or activity
stint.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Mark did a two-year stint in the army.
stint.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to provide or use too little of something
stint.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: They didnâ€™t stint on food and drink at their wedding.
In order to avoid stinting yourself, make sure you have enough money to cover all your expenses.
stint.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a limited or fixed period of time doing a particular job
stint.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: his two-year stint as managing director
Doing a stint overseas is important to getting ahead in many companies.
